intro: Lachenalia zeyheri, commonly known as the Zeyher’s lachenalia, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Amaryllidaceae family and is characterized by its compact, evergreen rosette of fleshy, linear leaves. The plant produces tall, branched stems that bear clusters of tubular, bell-shaped flowers in shades of yellow to orange. It thrives in well-drained, sandy soils and requires full sun to partial shade. Lachenalia zeyheri is a popular choice for rock gardens and xeriscaping due to its drought tolerance and ornamental value.
